content.question: Which of the following aspects of the immediate historical situation in China in 1958 best explains the author’s perspective in the passage?

choices.label: The Chinese Communist Party was buoyed by its recent victory in the country’s long civil war.
Chinese leaders had made it clear that meeting the goals of the Great Leap Forward was the highest priority facing the country.
Mao Zedong’s Cultural Revolution had created severe social upheavals and caused widespread suffering among those accused of political dissent.
The new Chinese Communist leadership implemented economic liberalization reform in the aftermath of Mao Zedong’s death.

content.answer: Chinese leaders had made it clear that meeting the goals of the Great Leap Forward was the highest priority facing the country.
